section.title: Fedora
section.para: The POWER8-crypto book provides instructions for a Ubuntu system. If you install on Fedora then you will need to manually tune the path to the DocBook stylesheets. This manual change is due to limitations in DocBook. DocBook does not allow us to conditionally include a local file. Also see How to import stylesheets in xslt conditionally? and How to overcome differences in location of docbook style files on Stack Overflow.

To make the change on Fedora open the file custom.xsl and locate the line <xsl:import href="/usr/share/xml/docbook/stylesheet/docbook-xsl/fo/docbook.xsl"/>. Change it to the location of the stylesheet, like /usr/share/sgml/docbook/xsl-stylesheets-1.79.2/fo/docbook.xsl.

The location will be dependent on the package you install. The location /usr/share/sgml/... is due to installing the Fedora package docbook-style-xsl, which is Norman Walsh's XSL stylesheets for DocBook.
Other packages you may need on Fedora include docbook-dtds, docbook-style-xsl, docbook-utils and docbook-utils-pdf.
